title: Vandals defile memorial to Holocaust victims on the eve of Yom Kippur
text:
On the eve of Yom Kippur, vandals left anti-Semitic hate symbols on a Westchester, New York, memorial honoring Holocaust victims.

And just days prior, a swastika and the name 'Trump' were found spray-painted on the steps of Yale's law school, WTNH reports.

These anti-Semitic hate crimes come as police have beefed up security ahead of the most significant holiday in the Jewish faith.

Days before Yom Kippur, a swastika and the name 'Trump' were found spray-painted on the steps of Yale's law school

Vandals left anti-Semitic hate symbols on the the holocaust Garden of Remembrance in Westchester County, New York, on the eve of Yom Kippur

'We are saddened by this act of hate against our community at any time but understand that this is particularly difficult occurring between the High Holy Days,' Ellen Cosgrove, associate dean of students at Yale Law School, told the student newspaper the Yale Daily News.

'Diversity and inclusion are core values of our institution [and] attacks against individual students or communities of students will not be tolerated,' she added.

A statement posted on Westchester County's Facebook page after the incident read: 'On the eve of Yom Kippur, the highest of holy days in the Jewish faith, anti-Semitic materials were discovered today at the Garden of Remembrance in downtown White Plains.

'We are enraged by this act and heartbroken that individuals would target members of our community on the most solemn day in their tradition. County Police are actively investigating and reviewing video of the area; we seek to find and punish those who did this act.

'We as a County, people of all faiths, stand with our Jewish brothers and sisters today and always.'

Westchester County posted a picture of the Holocaust Garden of Remembrance, writing County Police are on high alert and stepping up patrols after anti-Semitic materials were found at County Park.

The anti-Semitic vandalism came before Yom Kippur - the most significant holiday in the Jewish faith

The Garden of Remembrance was created by the Holocaust and Human Rights Education Center.

It includes the sculpture 'Gates of Remembrance' by Rita Rapaport, which memorializes the suffering and death of millions by Nazis during WWII.

In New York City police beefed up security for Yom Kippur, which runs from Tuesday to Wednesday, stationing 130 cops at city synagogues and 25 additional police cars in predominately Jewish neighborhoods.

'There's been some overtime put out, we're figuring a good 20-25 additional cars working in those areas, working around the synagogues, all night with their turret lights on,' NYPD Chief Terence Monahan said at a press conference on crime statistic Tuesday.

'Our neighborhood coordination officers, in our steady sectors have been tasked to go and visit every one of their synagogues that are having services within their sector today. So we're going to have a very large presence out in Brooklyn and throughout the city tonight through Yom Kippur,' he added.
description: Vandals left anti-Semitic hate symbols on the the holocaust Garden of Remembrance in Westchester County, New York, on eve of the most significant holiday in the Jewish faith.
